contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2007}} The ''People's World'' / ''Mundo Popular'', formerly the ''People's Weekly World'' / ''Nuestro Mundo'' (Spanish title: ''Our World'') is a national, grassroots daily news website and the direct descendant of the ''[[Daily Worker]]'', the east coast Communist Party daily newspaper, which was founded in 1924, and the Communist Party's west coast daily newspaper, ''The Daily People's World.'' Published by Long View Publishing Co., the ''PW'' reports on and analyzes what it sees as the pressing issues and struggles of the day: for workers’ rights, peace, equality, [[social justice|social]] and [[economic justice]], democracy, [[civil liberties]], [[women’s rights]], protection of the environment, and more. The ''PW'' is funded by its supporters and published by a small staff, and a network of volunteers. The newspaper is a member of the [[International Labor Communications Association]]. On January 1, 2010, the ''People's World'' became an online-only publication. The '''''People's World''''' ('''''PW''''') is a news web site associated with the [[Communist Party USA]], being part of the People Before Profit Network. ==External links== * [http://www.peoplesworld.org/ Official website] {{Communist Party USA}} [[Category:Communist newspapers]] [[Category:Newspapers published in New York City]] [[Category:American communist periodicals]] [[Category:American political magazines]] [[Category:Communist Party USA]] [[Category:Defunct newspapers of the United States]] [[Category:Online periodicals with defunct print editions]] {{NewYork-newspaper-stub}}
